line.comment: * DO NOT USE ARRAYS AS RETURN VALUES. USE TABLES INSTEAD.
* NOTE: [DATATYPE_TABLE] is not recognized by X-Studio. Use "if table get size: table = $return" instead.
* Target priorities.
* Remove monitored sectors.
* !ship.cmd.fleet.supply automatically checks if the supplier is needed by at least one fleet, so we don't need to check that here.

line.text: 'The supplier cannot be in a fleet'
'All ships are joining the fleet commander.'

line.comment: * Remove reinforcement.
* Fleet leader selection.
* Fleet member status.

line.text: 'Click on a follower to switch its current fleet status.'
'Fleet: dock at commander's homebase (no homebase set)'

line.comment: * $default = get index of $targetMaxRange in array $rangeConverter offset=0
* add value selection to menu: $menu, text='Target max. range of commander (most commands)', value array=$values, default=$default, return id='mayhem_fleetSettings.targetMaxRange'
* $default = get index of $protectMaxRange in array $rangeConverter offset=0
* add value selection to menu: $menu, text='Target max. range of commander (Protect command only)', value array=$values, default=$default, return id='mayhem_fleetSettings.protectMaxRange'

line.text: 'Followers are always scanning for enemies. Set this to 0 if you only want them to be active when the commander is.'
'Followers priorities: 1/ Priority attack 2/ Targets in scanning range 3/ Commander's attacker 4/ Commander's target.'
'Followers are sent to your nearest safe Outpost when their current sector is safe.'

line.comment: * $default = ($patrolTime / 5) - 1
* add value selection to menu: $menu, text='Patrol time for each sector, in minutes (Patrol command)', value array=$values, default=$default, return id='mayhem_fleetSettings.patrolTime'
* $t = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.InfoText' : text='This value is approximate and the patrol duration will always be a little longer.'
* add non selectable menu item: $menu, text=$t
* dim $values = 'Focused', 'Scattered'
* $default = $invasionStrategy
* add value selection to menu: $menu, text='Invasion strategy', value array=$values, default=$default, return id='mayhem_fleetSettings.invasionStrategy'
* $t = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.InfoText' : text='Each fleet ship attacks the same station in "Focused", and random station in "Scattered".'
* add non selectable menu item: $menu, text=$t

line.text: 'The supplier keeps checking the fleet's needs in missiles, and automatically orders them from its homebase, if any.'
'To make the followers attack a station, you need to put a priority at Station, or tell them to engage the commander's target.'
'Auto-rename the entire fleet when a new follower is built'
'See the Global ship naming menu for expressions.'
'If a hostile ship is detected, the commander will resume his previous task after interception.'
'A reinforcement is a ship template that will get automatically built if it's not already in the fleet.'
'If the same ship type has two different templates, only the ship type will be counted.'
'You can add new templates by using the Template manager from your Personal console.'
'Select a fleet commander to edit its settings.'

sval.val: The supplier cannot be in a fleet
All ships are joining the fleet commander.
All ships are docking at homebase.
The fleet commander is now defending
The fleet commander is now defending
Click on a follower to switch its current fleet status.
Commander: defend homebase sector (no homebase set)
Fleet: flee to nearest safe station
Fleet: dock at commander's homebase (no homebase set)
Followers are always scanning for enemies. Set this to 0 if you only want them to be active when the commander is.
Followers priorities: 1/ Priority attack 2/ Targets in scanning range 3/ Commander's attacker 4/ Commander's target.
Followers are sent to your nearest safe Outpost when their current sector is safe.
The supplier keeps checking the fleet's needs in missiles, and automatically orders them from its homebase, if any.
To make the followers attack a station, you need to put a priority at Station, or tell them to engage the commander's target.
Auto-rename the entire fleet when a new follower is built
See the Global ship naming menu for expressions.
If a hostile ship is detected, the commander will resume his previous task after interception.
A reinforcement is a ship template that will get automatically built if it's not already in the fleet.
If the same ship type has two different templates, only the ship type will be counted.
You can add new templates by using the Template manager from your Personal console.
Select a fleet commander to edit its settings.
DO NOT USE ARRAYS AS RETURN VALUES. USE TABLES INSTEAD.
NOTE: [DATATYPE_TABLE] is not recognized by X-Studio. Use "if table get size: table = $return" instead.
!ship.cmd.fleet.supply automatically checks if the supplier is needed by at least one fleet, so we don't need to check that here.
$default = get index of $targetMaxRange in array $rangeConverter offset=0
add value selection to menu: $menu, text='Target max. range of commander (most commands)', value array=$values, default=$default, return id='mayhem_fleetSettings.targetMaxRange'
$default = get index of $protectMaxRange in array $rangeConverter offset=0
add value selection to menu: $menu, text='Target max. range of commander (Protect command only)', value array=$values, default=$default, return id='mayhem_fleetSettings.protectMaxRange'
add value selection to menu: $menu, text='Patrol time for each sector, in minutes (Patrol command)', value array=$values, default=$default, return id='mayhem_fleetSettings.patrolTime'
$t = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.InfoText' : text='This value is approximate and the patrol duration will always be a little longer.'
add non selectable menu item: $menu, text=$t
add value selection to menu: $menu, text='Invasion strategy', value array=$values, default=$default, return id='mayhem_fleetSettings.invasionStrategy'
$t = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.InfoText' : text='Each fleet ship attacks the same station in "Focused", and random station in "Scattered".'
add non selectable menu item: $menu, text=$t
